sen.j: 関西鉄道（關西鐵道。かんさいてつどう、かんせいてつどう）は、明治時代に存在した現在の東海旅客鉄道・西日本旅客鉄道の路線にまたがる鉄道事業者で、関西本線・草津線・片町線・紀勢本線・桜井線・和歌山線・奈良線・大阪環状線の前身である。
sen.e: Kansai Railway Company (Pronounce kanji character as either Kansai Railway Company or Kansei Railway Company) is a railway industry who run railroad across Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central) and West Japan Railway Company's current railroad which existed in Meiji Period, and it is the predecessor of Kansai Main Line, Kusatsu Line, Katamachi Line, Kisei Main Line, Sakurai Line, Wakayama Line, Nara Line and Osaka Kanjo Line.

Kansai Railway Company (Pronounce kanji character as either Kansai Railway Company or Kansei Railway Company) is a railway industry who run railroad across Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central) and West Japan Railway Company's current railroad which existed in Meiji Period, and it is the predecessor of Kansai Main Line, Kusatsu Line, Katamachi Line, Kisei Main Line, Sakurai Line, Wakayama Line, Nara Line and Osaka Kanjo Line.

Kansai Railway Company (It's pronounced in kanji characters as either Kansai Railway Company or Kansei Railway Company) is a railway industry that runs railroads across Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central) and West Japan Railway Company (JR West)'s current railroad, which existed during the Meiji period; it is the predecessor of the Kansai Main Line, Kusatsu Line, Katamachi Line, Kisei Main Line, Sakurai Line, Wakayama Line, Nara Line and Osaka Loop Line.
sen.cmt: (JR West)追加 既出の記事と統一し、環状線をOsaka Loop Lineとしました。

sen.j: 本社は三重県四日市市にあったが後に事務所は大阪に移転した。
sen.e: The head office used to locate in Yokkaichi City, Mie Prefecture and the office moved to Osaka later on.
The head office was once located in Yokkaichi City, Mie Prefecture, but eventually the office moved to Osaka.
The head office was once located in Yokkaichi City, Mie Prefecture, but eventually the office moved to Osaka.

sen.j: 官営鉄道（官鉄）東海道本線のルートから外れた三重県・滋賀県の旧東海道沿いの地域を東海道線と連絡する目的で開業したが、周辺鉄道会社を合併することで路線規模を広げ、名古屋 - 大阪間の独自直通ルート開設を実現した。
sen.e: This railroad was opened to connect the area in Mie and Shiga Prefecture along the old Tokaido where was not included in the route of Tokaido Main Line, Government Railway (Kantetsu), Kansai Railway Company merged other surrounded railway company to expand the route to be able to set up their own direct route between Nagoya and Osaka.

This railroad was opened in order to connect the area in Mie and Shiga prefectures along the old Tokaido, which was not included in the route of the Tokaido Main Line; meanwhile, the Government Railway (Kantetsu), Kansai Railway Company merged other surrounding railway companies to expand the route in order to set up a direct route between Nagoya and Osaka.

This railroad was opened in order to connect the area in Mie and Shiga prefectures along the old Tokaido, which was not included in the route of the Tokaido Main Line of the Government Railway (Kantetsu); meanwhile, the Kansai Railway Company merged other surrounding railway companies to expand the route in order to set up a direct route between Nagoya and Osaka.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味合いにするために一部修正

sen.j: 東海道線との間で壮絶な旅客獲得競争を繰り広げたことが後世まで有名になっている（官鉄との競争）。
sen.e: The famous story was handed down to after ages that Kansai Railway Company had a fierce battles against Government Railway company to get more passengers.
The famous story, which has been handed through the years, states that the Kansai Railway Company had a fierce battles against the Government Railway Company to get more passengers.
The famous story, which has been handed through the years, states that the Kansai Railway Company had a fierce battles against the Government Railway Company to get more passengers.

sen.j: 旅客サービスや車両技術において先進的な試みを行ったことでも知られるが、これを支えたのは初期に同社の技師として、日本の鉄道技術の先駆者と言われる島安次郎が在職したという背景がある（彼は新幹線実現の功労者である島秀雄の実父でもある）。
sen.e: The company is well known for providing progressive approach for customer services and the vehicle technology, Yasujiro SHIMA, an engineer worked in early ages and known as a pioneer of Japanese railway technician, made a big contribution to the company. (He is a son of Hideo SHIMA who was the contributor to make bullet trains.)

The company is well known for providing a progressive approach to customer service and vehicle technology; Yasujiro SHIMA, an engineer, worked in the early years and became known as a pioneering Japanese railway technologist, eventually making a big contribution to the company (he was the son of Hideo SHIMA, who was the contributor to the production of bullet trains).

The company is well known for its progressive approach to customer service and vehicle technology; Yasujiro SHIMA, an engineer, worked in the early years and became known as a pioneering Japanese railway technologist, eventually making a big contribution to the company (he was the son of Hideo SHIMA, who was a contributor to the production of Shinkansen (bullet trains)).

tit.e: From establishment to opening of Meihan (Nagoya to Osaka)
From the establishment to the opening of Meihan (Nagoya to Osaka)
From the establishment to the opening of Meihan (Nagoya to Osaka)

sen.j: 当初は官設鉄道の経路から外れた東海道沿いの滋賀、三重県下の都市を東海道線に結ぶ目的で設立された。
sen.e: Originally it was set up to connect the cities in Shiga and Mie Prefecture along Tokaido to Tokaido Line, where was not included in the route of Government Railway company.
Originally it was set up to connect the cities in Shiga and Mie prefectures along the Tokaido to the Tokaido Line, which was not included in the route of the Government Railway Company.
Originally it was set up to connect the cities in Shiga and Mie prefectures along the Tokaido to the Tokaido Line, which was not included in the route of the Government Railway Company.

sen.j: その後、路線を西へ奈良に延長、片町駅 - 四条畷駅を開業していた浪速鉄道および四条畷から木津方面の路線免許を持つ（未開業の）城河鉄道を合併して現在の片町線経由で名阪間を開通、1898年（明治31年）に大阪片町にターミナルを入手した。
sen.e: After that the route was expanded to Nara on West, merged Naniwa Railway who used to run trains between Katamachi Station and Shijo nawate Station, and Joga Railway who had a railway license from Shijo nawate to Kizu (not in operation), the Kansai Railway Company opened the new route from Meihan via current Katamachi Line and established a terminal in Katamachi, Osaka in 1898.

The route was subsequently expanded to Nara in the west, merging with Naniwa Railway, which used to run trains between Katamachi Station and Shijo-nawate Station, and the Joga Railway, which had a railway license from Shijo-nawate to Kizu (not in operation); the Kansai Railway Company opened the new route from Meihan via the current Katamachi Line and established a terminal in Katamachi, Osaka in 1898.

The route was subsequently expanded to Nara in the west, merging with Naniwa Railway, which used to run trains between Katamachi Station and Shijo-Nawate Station, and the Joga Railway (which was not yet in operation), which had a railway license from Shijo-Nawate to Kizu; the Kansai Railway Company opened the new route of Meihan via the current Katamachi Line and established a terminal in Katamachi, Osaka in 1898.
sen.cmt: Shijo-Nawateとしました。 未開業 の位置を移動

sen.j: しかし、敷地の拡張が困難なため網島駅（廃止）に起点を移設、さらにJR難波駅から奈良に路線網を持つ大阪鉄道 (初代)を合併し現在の関西本線を全通、湊町にターミナルを再度移転させた。
sen.e: As it was hard to expand off to the site, the origination was moved to Amijima Station (currently closed), Osaka Railway who had railroad between JR Nanba Station to Nara was merged and opened current Kansai Main Line and re-established a terminal at Minatomachi.

Because it was hard to expand off to the site, the origination was moved to Amijima Station (currently closed; Osaka Railway, which had railroad between JR Nanba Station and Nara, was merged and opened the current Kansai Main Line, re-establishing a terminal at Minatomachi.

Because it was hard to expand off the site, the origination was moved to Amijima Station (currently closed); Osaka Railway, which had railroad between JR Nanba Station and Nara, was merged and the current Kansai Main Line was opened, re-establishing a terminal at Minatomachi.
sen.cmt: JR Namba としました。"Namba"→"Nanba"に変更しました。

tit.e: Competition Against the Government Railway Company
Competition Against the Government Railway Company

sen.j: 名阪全通に伴い、官設鉄道との間でこの区間の旅客・貨物を巡る競争が始まった。
sen.e: After Meihan route opened the competition in this sector over the cargo and passengers started against Government Railway company.
After Meihan route opened the competition in this sector over the cargo and passengers started against Government Railway company.
Once the Meihan route opened, competition for freight and passengers in this sector emerged against the Government Railway Company.
sen.cmt: 既出の鉄道の記事と統一しfreightとしました

sen.j: これは、関西鉄道を吸収した側の官鉄の正史ともいえる「日本鉄道史」にも紙幅を割いて触れられるほどであった。
sen.e: It was mentioned in 'Japan Railway History' which was an authentic history book of the Government Railway who absorbed Kansai Railway Company.
It was mentioned in 'Japan Railway History,' an authentic history book of the Government Railway, which absorbed the Kansai Railway Company.
It was mentioned in 'Japan Railway History,' an authentic history book of the Government Railway, which absorbed the Kansai Railway Company.

sen.j: 関西鉄道は、昼行1往復・夜行1往復で料金不要の急行列車を設定した。
sen.e: Kansai Railway Company introduced an express fare free train which makes one round trip in daytime and one in night time.
The Kansai Railway Company introduced an express-fare free train, which makes one round trip in the daytime and one during the night.
The Kansai Railway Company introduced an express-fare free train, which makes one round trip in the daytime and one during the night.

sen.j: 新式の「早風（はやかぜ）」（後の国鉄6500形蒸気機関車）と名づけられた蒸気機関車を用いた急行は、同区間を昼行では下り5時間34分・上り5時間16分、夜行は下り6時間41分・上り6時間3分で走破した。
sen.e: The new style express train using steam train called 'Hayakaze' (afterwards called JNR Steam Locomotive Type 6500) run in the same sector for five hours and thirty four minutes for going downtown and five hours and sixteen minutes going uptown in daytime, also run six hours forty one minutes for going downtown, six hours three minutes going uptown in night time.

The new style of express train using a steam engine, called 'Hayakaze' (later called the JNR Steam Locomotive Type 6500) ran in the same sector for 5 hours 34 minutes for going downtown and 5 hours 16 minutes going uptown in the daytime; it also 6 hours 41 minutes for going downtown and 6 hours 3 minutes going uptown during the night.

The new style of express train using a steam engine, called 'Hayakaze' (later called the JNR Steam Locomotive Type 6500) ran in the same sector for 5 hours 34 minutes outbound and 5 hours 16 minutes inbound in the daytime; it ran 6 hours 41 minutes outbound and 6 hours 3 minutes inbound during the night.
sen.cmt: 単語を追加 上り→inbound 下り→outbound

sen.j: この時、官鉄の下り急行列車は名古屋駅 - 大阪駅間において昼行が6時間4分、夜行が5時間20分で走破し、運賃も同額の1円21銭であったから、勝負はほぼ互角であった。
sen.e: It cost one yen and twenty one sen for Government Railway Express train to go downtown from Nagoya Station to Osaka Station taking six hours and four minutes in daytime, five hours and twenty minutes in night time, roughly same as Kansai Railway Company.

It cost one yen and 21 sen to take the Government Railway Express train downtown from Nagoya Station to Osaka Station; the trip took 6 hours 4 minutes in the daytime and 5 hours 20 minutes in the nighttime, roughly the same as the Kansai Railway Company.

It cost one yen and 21 sen to take the Government Railway Express outbound train from Nagoya Station to Osaka Station; the trip took 6 hours 4 minutes in the daytime and 5 hours 20 minutes in the nighttime, roughly the same as the Kansai Railway Company.

sen.j: 1900年（明治33年）には、奈良駅・天王寺駅経由の現在の関西本線ルート（湊町駅（今のJR難波駅） - 名古屋駅）が完成し、昼行急行に関してはこちらのルートを通すようになった。
sen.e: In 1900 the current Kansai Main Line route (Minatomachi Station, current JR Nanba Station to Nagoya Station) via Nara Station and Tennoji Station completed, this route was used for daytime Express train.

In 1900 the current Kansai Main Line route (Minatomachi Station, currently JR Nanba Station to Nagoya Station) via Nara Station and Tennoji Station was completed; this route was used for daytime express train.

In 1900 the current Kansai Main Line route (from Minatomachi Station (current JR Nanba Station) to Nagoya Station) via Nara Station and Tennoji Station was completed; this route was used for the daytime express train.

sen.j: しかし所要時間はこの時若干伸びた。
sen.e: However running time of this route lengthened.
However, the running time of this route was lengthened.
However, the running time of this route was lengthened.

sen.j: その後、1902年（明治35年）には再び所要時間を短縮し、5時間弱の運転とした。
sen.e: After that the running time was shortened to about five hours in 1902.
Subsequently, the running time was shortened to about five hours in 1902.
Subsequently, the running time was shortened to about five hours in 1902.

sen.j: 急行列車には1904年（明治37年）より食堂車も連結されるようになった。
sen.e: In 1904 the dinning car/diner was connected to the Express train.
In 1904 the dining car was connected to the express train.
In 1904 the dining car was connected to the express train.

sen.j: 1902年（明治35年）8月1日、官鉄の同区間の片道運賃が1円77銭・往復運賃が2円30銭だったのに対して、関西鉄道が往復運賃を2円（片道は1円47銭）に値下げると、官鉄は慌てて同月6日に往復運賃を1円47銭に値下げし、往復運賃が片道運賃を下回るという事態になった。
sen.e: While the single train fare being one yen and seventy seven sen, the return fare being two yen and thirty sen of this sector of the Government Railway from August 1st,1902, after Kansai Railway Company decreased the return fare to two yen (single fare was one yen and forty seven sen), the Government Railway decreased the return fare of the same sector to one yen and forty seven sen on August 6th, 1902, this caused the return fare being cheaper than single fare.

While the single train fare was one yen and 77 sen, the return fare was two yen and 30 sen on this section of the Government Railway from August 1, 1902, subsequently the Kansai Railway Company decreased the return fare to two yen (the single fare was one yen and 47 sen) and the Government Railway decreased the return fare of the same section to one yen and 47 sen on August 6, 1902, which caused the return fare to be less than the single fare.

While the single train fare was one yen and 77 sen, the return fare was two yen and 30 sen on this section of the Government Railway from August 1, 1902, subsequently the Kansai Railway Company decreased the return fare to two yen (the single fare was one yen and 47 sen) and the Government Railway decreased the return fare of the same section to one yen and 47 sen on August 6, 1902, which caused the return fare to be less than the single fare.

sen.j: 関西鉄道もすぐさま往復運賃を1円50銭に値下げし、団扇などといった小物のサービスを行うなどして競争は泥沼化して行った。
sen.e: Soon Kansai Railway Company decreased the return fare to one yen and fifty sen, giving away free fans as part of their service, the competition evolved into a hopeless mess.
Soon the Kansai Railway Company decreased the return fare to one yen and 50 sen, giving away free fans as part of its service; consequently the competition became a hopeless mess.
Soon the Kansai Railway Company decreased the return fare to one yen and 50 sen, giving away free fans as part of its service; consequently the competition became a hopeless mess.

sen.j: 同年末に名古屋商業会議所の建議により大阪府知事、国会議員等の調停がなされ和解が成立したものの、翌年10月になって関西鉄道側が一方的に協定を破棄する形で競争が再開され、同鉄道は片道運賃を1円10銭・往復運賃を1円20銭とし、弁当などもサービスする有様となった。
sen.e: Although the both parties were reconciled after the adjustment with the the Governor of Osaka-fu and the Diet members, which was suggested by Nagoya chamber of commerce in the end of the same year, the competition started again after Kansai Railway Company breached an arrangement one-sidedly, after all the same railway set the single fare for one yen and ten sen, return fare for one yen and twenty sen and started to give out free lunch boxes.

Although both parties were reconciled after the adjustment with the Governor of Osaka-fu and the members of the Diet, which was suggested by the Nagoya Chamber of Commerce at the end of the same year, the competition started again after the Kansai Railway Company breached an arrangement one-sidedly, given that the same railway had set the single fare for one yen and 10 sen, return fare for one yen and 20 sen and started to give out free lunch boxes.

Although both parties were reconciled after the adjustment by the Governor of Osaka Prefecture and the members of the Diet, which was suggested by the Nagoya Chamber of Commerce at the end of the same year, in October of the followng year, the competition started again after the Kansai Railway Company breached the arrangement, given that the same railway had set the single fare for one yen and 10 sen, return fare for one yen and 20 sen and started giving out free lunch boxes.
sen.cmt: Osaka Prefectureとしました。「翌年10月になって」を補足

sen.j: 当然過当競争状態であったが、関西鉄道はほとんど「やけくそ」で勝負していたようである（関西鉄道の社長は倒産も覚悟し、「どうせ潰れるなら官鉄を潰してから」といったと言われる）。
sen.e: It was an excessive competition and especially Kansai Railway Company was desperate to win this competition. (It is said the president of Kansai Railway Company was prepared to close the company and once mentioned 'We have to make sure that the company will bankrupt after the Government Railway does.')

It was excessive competition, and particularly the Kansai Railway Company was desperate to win (it is said that the president of Kansai Railway Company was prepared to close the company and once mentioned, 'We have to make sure that the company won't go bankrupt until after the Government Railway has').

It was excessive competition, and particularly the Kansai Railway Company was desperate to win (it is said that the president of Kansai Railway Company was prepared to close the company and once mentioned, 'We have to make sure that the company won't go bankrupt until after the Government Railway has').

sen.j: この競争は、1904年（明治37年）2月に日露戦争が勃発したことで輸送が軍需優先となったため、同年5月にようやく終結した。
sen.e: This competition ceased in May 1904, after Japanese-Russo War/Russo-Japanese War started in February 1904 and the transportation of war supplies had the most priority.
This competition ceased in May 1904, after the start of the Russo-Japanese War in February of that year, and the transportation of war supplies had the top priority.
This competition ceased in May 1904, after the start of the Russo-Japanese War in February of that year, and the transportation of war supplies had the top priority.

tit.e: The merger of railway companies in the Kinki area
tit.cmt: 「近畿地方の鉄道会社の合併」としました。

sen.j: 合併によって近畿地方での存在感が高まるにつれ、周辺の私鉄が関西鉄道に合流する動きがでてきた。
sen.e: After the merger of the company, Kansai Railway company started showing their presence in Kinki area, other private railway company seemed to merge with Kansai Railway Company.
After the merger of the company, Kansai Railway company started showing their presence in Kinki area, other private railway company seemed to merge with Kansai Railway Company.
After the merger, the Kansai Railway Company developed a presence in the Kinki area, and other private railway companies started to follow the trend to merge with the Kansai Railway Company.

sen.j: 1904年に紀和鉄道が合併した後、同年に近畿鉄道合同委員会を設け南和鉄道、奈良鉄道が合流した。
sen.e: After the merger of Kiwa Railway in 1904, Kintetsu Corporation joint board was set up in the same year and Nanwa Railway and Nara Railway merged to Kansai Railway Company.
After the merger of the Kiwa Railway in 1904, the joint board of Kintetsu Corporation was set up in the same year and the Nanwa and Nara railways merged into the Kansai Railway Company.
After the merger of the Kiwa Railway in 1904, the Joint Board of Railway Companies in Kinki area was set up in the same year and the Nanwa and Nara railways merged into the Kansai Railway Company.
sen.cmt: 近畿鉄道合同委員会 Joint Board of Railway Companies in Kinki areaとしました（定訳不明）

sen.j: 南海鉄道は委員会に加わったものの合流に至らなかった。
sen.e: Although Nankai Railway joined into the joint board, they did not merge into Kansai Railway Company.
Although the Nankai Railway participated in the joint board, it did not merge into the Kansai Railway Company.
Although the Nankai Railway participated in the joint board, it did not merge into the Kansai Railway Company.

sen.j: その後関西鉄道は、1906年（明治39年）公布の鉄道国有法により1907年（明治40年）10月1日に国有化された。
sen.e: Kansai Railway Company was nationalized on October 1st, 1907 after the Railway Nationalization Act was issued in 1906.
The Kansai Railway Company was nationalized on October 1, 1907, following the issuance of the Railway Nationalization Act in 1906.
The Kansai Railway Company was nationalized on October 1, 1907, following the issuance of the Railway Nationalization Act in 1906.

sen.j: 路線299マイル16チェーン (単位)（開業線280M72C、未開業線18M24C）機関車121、客車571、貨車1273が引き継がれた。
sen.e: Line 299 mile, 16 chain (unit value) (opened line 280M72C, unopened line 18M24C), locomotives 121 and passenger cars 571, freight cars 1273 were passed on.
Line 299 mile, 16 chain (unit value) (opened line 280M72C, unopened line 18M24C), 121 locomotives, 571 passenger cars and 1273 freight cars were passed on.
Line 299 mile, 16 chain (unit value) (opened line 280M72C, unopened line 18M24C), 121 locomotives, 571 passenger cars and 1273 freight cars were passed on.

sen.j: 一地方のみの路線であるので国有化を除外されたいとの請願書を出したが受け入れられなかった。
sen.e: Although petition for exemption was passed on, as Kansai Railway Company was local based railway, it was not accepted by the government.
Although a petition for exemption was submitted, because the Kansai Railway Company was a locally based railway, it was not accepted by the government.
Although a petition for exemption was submitted, because the Kansai Railway Company was a locally based railway, it was not accepted by the government.

sen.j: 国有化直前、同社は主要幹線である湊町 - 奈良 - 京都駅間と、名古屋 - 河原田駅間および城東線（現・大阪環状線）の電化計画を立てて認可を受けていたが、これは国有化に当たって買収額を高くするための方策であったとする見方もある。
sen.e: Just before the nationalization, the company had an approval of their electrification plan for the sector of Minato machi, Nara and Kyoto as well as Nagoya - Kawarada Station, and Joto Line (Current Osaka Kanjo Line), some people said this was the tactics to increase the amount paid for acquisition due to company's nationalization.

Just before the nationalization, the company had an approval of its electrification plan for the section of Minato-machi, Nara and Kyoto as well as Nagoya - Kawarada Station, and the Joto Line (currently the Osaka Kanjo Line), some people said this was a tactic to increase the amount paid for acquisition due to the company's nationalization.

Just before the nationalization, the company had an approval of its electrification plan for the section of Minatomachi, Nara and Kyoto as well as Nagoya - Kawarada Station, and the Joto Line (currently the Osaka Loop Line), but some people said this was a tactic to increase the amount paid for acquisition due to the company's nationalization.
sen.cmt: Minatomachi, Osaka Loop Lineとしました。

sen.j: 電化は国有化後全く顧みられず、1920年代以降に発展した現在の近畿日本鉄道の路線網に機能をとって代わられた。
sen.e: The electrification plan did not go ahead after the nationalization, the line network of the current Kintetsu Corporation took place, which was developed since 1920.
The electrification plan did not proceed after the nationalization, but instead the line network of the current Kintetsu Corporation took place, which had been in development since 1920.
The electrification plan did not proceed after the nationalization, but instead the line network of the current Kintetsu Corporation took place, which had been in development since 1920.

sen.j: 日付は日本鉄道史による
sen.e: The date based on Japan Railroad history
The date based on Japan Railroad history
The date based on Japan Railroad history

sen.j: 1888年（明治21年）3月1日 三重県四日市市に資本金300万円で設立が許可
sen.e: On March 1st, 1888 Kansai Railway Company had an approval of establishing a company with three million yen in capital in Yokkaichi City, Mie Prefecture.
On March 1, 1888, the Kansai Railway Company had an approval to establish a company with three million yen in capital in Yokkaichi City, Mie Prefecture.
March 1, 1888: The Kansai Railway Company had an approval to establish a company with three million yen in capital in Yokkaichi City, Mie Prefecture.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）12月15日 草津駅 (滋賀県) - 三雲駅間開業
sen.e: On December 15th, 1889 the operation started between Kusatsu Station (Shiga Prefecture) and Mikumo Station.
On December 15, 1889 the operation started between Kusatsu Station (Shiga Prefecture) and Mikumo Station.
On December 15, 1889: The operation started between Kusatsu Station (Shiga Prefecture) and Mikumo Station.

sen.j: 1890年（明治23年）2月19日 三雲 - 柘植駅間開通、現在の草津線全通
sen.e: On February 19th, 1890 the sector between Mikumo Station and Tsuge Station, current Kusatsu Line opened.
On February 19, 1890 the sector between Mikumo Station and Tsuge Station (the current Kusatsu Line) opened.
February 19, 1890: The sector between Mikumo Station and Tsuge Station (the current Kusatsu Line) opened.

sen.j: 1890年（明治23年）12月25日 四日市駅 - 柘植間開業
sen.e: On December 25th, 1890 the operation started between Yokkaichi Station and Tsuge Station.
On December 25, 1890 the operation started between Yokkaichi Station and Tsuge Station.
December 25, 1890: The operation started between Yokkaichi Station and Tsuge Station.

sen.j: 1891年（明治24年）8月21日 亀山駅 (三重県) - 一身田駅間開業
sen.e: On August 21st,1891 the sector between Kameyama Station (Mie Prefecture) and Isshinden Station opened.
On August 21, 1891 the sector between Kameyama Station (Mie Prefecture) and Isshinden Station opened.
August 21, 1891: The sector between Kameyama Station (Mie Prefecture) and Isshinden Station opened.

sen.j: 1891年（明治24年）11月1日 一身田 - 津駅間開業
sen.e: On 1st November, 1891 the operation started between Isshinden Station and Tsu Station.
On November 1, 1891 the operation started between Isshinden Station and Tsu Station.
November 1, 1891: The operation started between Isshinden Station and Tsu Station.

sen.j: 1894年（明治27年）7月5日 四日市 - 桑名仮停車場延伸開業
sen.e: On July 5th, 1894 Kuwana temporary train station started operation with extended platform.
On July 5, 1894, the Kuwana temporary train station started operation with extended platform.
July 5, 1894: The extension work between Yokkaichi and Kuwana temporary station commenced.

sen.j: 1895年（明治28年）5月24日 桑名仮停車場 - 桑名駅延伸開業、および名古屋駅 - 弥富駅開業
sen.e: On May 24th, 1895 Kuwana Station started tentative operation with extended platform and the sector between Nagoya Station and Yatomi Station opened.
On May 24, 1895, Kuwana Station started tentative operation with an extended platform, and the sector between Nagoya Station and Yatomi Station opened.
May 24, 1895: The extension work from Kuwana temporary station to Kuwana Station started, and the sector between Nagoya Station and Yatomi Station opened.

sen.j: 1895年（明治28年）11月7日 弥富 - 桑名間開業により草津 - 名古屋駅全通
sen.e: On 7th November 1895 after the sector between Yatomi Station and Kuwana Station opened, the sector between Kusatsu Station and Nagoya Station opened.
On November 7, 1895, after the sector between Yatomi Station and Kuwana Station opened, the sector between Kusatsu Station and Nagoya Station opened.
November 7, 1895: After the sector between Yatomi Station and Kuwana Station opened, the sector between Kusatsu Station and Nagoya Station opened.

sen.j: 1897年（明治30年）1月15日 柘植 - 上野（現、伊賀上野駅）間開業
sen.e: On January 15th, 1897 the operation started between Tsuge Station and Ueno Station. (current Iga ueno Station)
On January 15, 1897 the operation started between Tsuge Station and Ueno Station. (currently Iga Ueno Station).
January 15, 1897: The operation started between Tsuge Station and Ueno Station. (currently Iga Ueno Station).

sen.j: 1897年（明治30年）2月9日 浪速鉄道を合併（片町駅 - 四条畷駅）
sen.e: On February 9th, 1897 Naniwa Railway was merged. (Kataoka Station and Shijo nawate Station)
On February 9, 1897, the Naniwa Railway was merged (Kataoka Station and Shijo nawate Station).
February 9, 1897: The Naniwa Railway was merged (Kataoka Station and Shijo-Nawate Station).
sen.cmt: Shijo-Nawate Stationとしました。年表表記に統一

sen.j: 1897年（明治30年）11月11日 上野 - 加茂駅 (京都府)間開業
sen.e: On November 11th, 1897 the operation started between Ueno Station and Kamo Station. (Kyoto-Prefecture)
On November 11, 1897 the operation started between Ueno Station and Kamo Station. (Kyoto-Prefecture).
November 11, 1897: The operation started between Ueno Station and Kamo Station (Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: (Kyoto Prefecture) としました。年表表記に統一

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）4月12日 四条畷駅 - 長尾駅 (大阪府)間開業
sen.e: On April 12th, 1898 the operation started between Shijo nawate Station and Nagao Station. (Osaka-Prefecture)
On April 12, 1898 the operation started between Shijo-nawate Station and Nagao Station. (Osaka-Prefecture).
April 12, 1898: The operation started between Shijo-Nawate Station and Nagao Station (Osaka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 単語修正年表表記に統一

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）4月19日 加茂 - 大仏駅間、通称大仏線または大仏鉄道開業
sen.e: On April 19th, 1898 the operation started between Kamo Station and Daibutsu Station, the line was also called Daibutsu Line or Daibutsu Railway.
On April 19, 1898 the operation started between Kamo Station and Daibutsu Station, and the line was also called Daibutsu Line or Daibutsu Railway.
April 19, 1898: The operation started between Kamo Station and Daibutsu Station, and the line was also called Daibutsu Line or Daibutsu Railway.

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）6月4日 新木津 - 四条畷間開業
sen.e: On June 4th, 1898 the operation started between Shin-Kizu Station and Shijo nawate Station.
On June 4, 1898 the operation started between Shin-Kizu Station and Shijo-nawate Station.
June 4, 1898: The operation started between Shin-Kizu Station and Shijo-Nawate Station.
sen.cmt: Shijo-Nawate Stationとしました。年表表記に統一

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）9月16日 新木津 - 木津間開業
sen.e: On 16th September 1898 the operation started between Shin-Kizu Station and Kizu Station.
On September 16, 1898 the operation started between Shin-Kizu Station and Kizu Station.
September 16: 1898: The operation started between Shin-Kizu Station and Kizu Station.

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）11月18日 加茂 - 新木津駅間、寝屋川 - 網島駅間開業、これにより名古屋 - 網島駅間全通、同経路で急行列車の運行開始
sen.e: On November 18th, 1898 the operation started between Kamo Station and Shin-Kizu Station, and between Neyagawa Station and Amijima Station, due to this the sector between Nagoya Station and Amijima Station fully opened and the Express train stared running on the same sector.

On November 18, 1898 the operation started between Kamo Station and Shin-Kizu Station, and between Neyagawa Station and Amijima Station; consequently, the section between Nagoya Station and Amijima Station fully opened and the express train stated running on the same section.

November 18: 1898: The operation started between Kamo Station and Shin-Kizu Station, and between Neyagawa Station and Amijima Station; consequently, the section between Nagoya Station and Amijima Station fully opened and the express train stated running on the same section.

sen.j: 1899年（明治32年）5月21日 大仏線大仏駅 - 奈良駅間開業、奈良駅へ乗り入れ
sen.e: On 21st May 1899 the operation started between Daibutsu Station of Daibutsu Line and Nara Station, trains started running into Nara Station.
On May 21, 1899 the operation started between Daibutsu Station of Daibutsu Line and Nara Station, and trains started running into Nara Station.
May 21, 1899: The operation started between Daibutsu Station of Daibutsu Line and Nara Station, and trains started running into Nara Station.

sen.j: 1900年（明治33年）6月6日 大阪鉄道 (初代)譲受（JR難波駅 - 奈良、王寺駅 - 桜井駅 (奈良県)、天王寺駅 - 大阪駅）
sen.e: On June 6th, 1900 Osaka Railway (original) was transferred. (JR Nanba Station - Nara,Oji (Station) - Sakurai Station (Nara Prefecture), Tennoji Station-Osaka Station)
On June 6, 1900, the Osaka Railway (original) was transferred (JR Nanba Station - Nara, Oji (Station) - Sakurai Station (Nara Prefecture), Tennoji Station-Osaka Station).
June 6, 1900: The Osaka Railway (original) was transferred (JR Nanba Station - Nara, Oji Station - Sakurai Station (Nara Prefecture), Tennoji Station-Osaka Station).
sen.cmt: nambaとしました。年表表記に統一"Namba"→"Nanba "二変更しました。

sen.j: 1901年（明治34年）12月21日 網島 - 桜ノ宮駅間開業
sen.e: December 21st, 1901 the operation started the sector between Amijima Station and Sakuranomiya Station.
On December 21, 1901, operation started on the section between Amijima Station and Sakuranomiya Station.
December 21, 1901: Operation started on the section between Amijima Station and Sakuranomiya Station.

sen.j: 1903年（明治36年）1月5日 天王寺 - 第五回内国勧業博覧会開業貨物営業開始、3月1日旅客営業開始、8 - 9月に施設撤去
sen.e: On January 5th, 1903 in Tennoji, the 5th Naikoku kangyo hakurankai (National expo) opened and started cargo operation, on March 1st, the passenger service also started, the facility was removed in August and September.

On January 5th, 1903 in Tennoji, the 5th Naikoku kangyo hakurankai (National expo) opened and started cargo operation, on March 1st, the passenger service also started, the facility was removed in August and September.

January 5, 1903: In Tennoji, the fifth Naikoku kangyo hakurankai (National Expo) opened and started freight operation, and on March 1the passenger service also started, but the facility was removed in August and September.
sen.cmt: freightとしました。年表表記に統一

sen.j: 1904年（明治37年）8月27日 紀和鉄道譲受（五条駅 (奈良県) - 紀和駅）
sen.e: August 27th, 1904 Kiwa Railway was accepted. (Gojo Station (Nara-Prefecture) -Kiwa Station)
On August 27, 1904, the Kiwa Railway was accepted (Gojo Station (Nara-Prefecture) -Kiwa Station).
August 27, 1904: The Kiwa Railway was accepted (Gojo Station (Nara Prefecture) -Kiwa Station).
sen.cmt: Nara Prefectureとしました。年表表記に統一

sen.j: 1904年（明治37年）12月9日 南和鉄道譲受（高田駅 (奈良県) - 五条）
sen.e: December 9th, 1904 Nanwa Railway was accepted. (Takada Station (Nara Prefecture) -Gojo)
On December 9, 1904, the Nanwa Railway was accepted (Takada Station (Nara Prefecture) -Gojo).
December 9, 1904: The Nanwa Railway was accepted (Takada Station (Nara Prefecture) -Gojo).

sen.j: 1905年（明治38年）2月8日 奈良鉄道譲受（京都駅 - 桜井）
sen.e: February 8th, 1905 Nara Railway was accepted. (Kyoto Station - Sakurai)
February 8, 1905, the Nara Railway was accepted (Kyoto Station - Sakurai).
February 8, 1905: The Nara Railway was accepted (Kyoto Station - Sakurai).

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）8月21日 木津付近で経路変更、現在の形を構築
sen.e: August 21st, 1907 the route was changed around Kizu and current route was established.
August 21, 1907, the route was changed around Kizu and current route was established.
August 21, 1907: The route was changed around Kizu and current route was established.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）8月 大仏線廃線（1907年旅客駅廃止：貨物駅として存続）
sen.e: August on 1907, Daibutsu Line was demolished. (The train station was closed in 1907 and remained as a cargo station.)
August on 1907, the Daibutsu Line was demolished. (The train station was closed in 1907 and remained as a cargo station.)
August on 1907: The Daibutsu Line was demolished (the train station was closed in 1907 and remained as a freight station).
sen.cmt: freightとしました。年表表記に統一

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）10月1日 鉄道国有法により国有化
sen.e: On 1st October 1907 the Kansai Railway Company was nationalized after the issue of the Railway Nationalization Raw.
On October 1, 1907, the Kansai Railway Company was nationalized after the issue of the Railway Nationalization Raw.
October 1, 1907: The Kansai Railway Company was nationalized after the issue of the Railway Nationalization Law.

sen.j: 関西鉄道の蒸気機関車の形式は、原則として同形機の最初の番号を採ったが、形式ごとに日本語によるクラス名が付けられており、特色となっていた。
sen.e: The type of Kansai Railway locomotive trains originally came from the first number of the same model number, each type had characteristic Japanese class names.
The type of Kansai Railway locomotive trains originally came from the first number of the same model number, each type had characteristic Japanese class names.
The type of Kansai Railway locomotive train originally came from the first number of the same model number, and each type had a characteristic Japanese class name.

sen.j: その多くは古典文学作品に登場する駿馬の名に由来しており、特に磨墨・池月は平家物語に登場し、宇治川の戦いの先陣争いで知られた源頼朝の愛馬から採られている。
sen.e: The most of the names came from fine horses of Japanese classic literature, especially the name Surusume and Ikezuki are in The Tale of the Taira Clan/The Tale of the Heike/Heike Monogatari and came from MINAMOTO no Yoritomo's favorite horse in the competition to be the first rider in a charge at the battle of Uji-gawa River/The battle at Uji-gawa River.

The majority of the names came from fine horses of Japanese classic literature, particularly the name Surusume and Ikezuki are in "The Tale of the Taira Clan (The Tale of the Heike/Heike Monogatari)" and came from MINAMOTO no Yoritomo's favorite horse in the competition to be the first rider in a charge at the battle of the Uji-gawa River.

The majority of the names came from fine horses of Japanese classic literature; for example, the names Surusumi and Ikezuki are in The Tale of the Taira Clan (The Tale of the Heike/Heike Monogatari) and came from MINAMOTO no Yoritomo's favorite horse in the competition to be the first rider in a charge at the Battle of the Uji-gawa River.

sen.j: 客車の窓下に等級識別の帯を塗装する手法（一等車を白、二等車を青、普通車 (鉄道車両)を赤）は、関西鉄道が最初に導入したものである。
sen.e: Kansai Railway company first introduced the way to identify the grade of the passenger trains by painting the various colored ribbon depending on the grade under the window. (The first class car with white, the second car with blue and an ordinary car (rail car) with red color.)

The Kansai Railway company first introduced the way to identify the grades of passenger trains by painting them in various colored bands (depending on the grade) under the window (the first-class car with white, the second car with blue and an ordinary car (rail car) with red color).

The Kansai Railway Company first introduced the way to identify the grades of passenger trains by painting them in various colored bands (depending on the grade) under the window (the first-class car with white, the second car with blue and an ordinary car (rail car) with red color).

sen.j: 旅客にも一目で等級を区別でき、便利なことから、国有化後に広く採用されるに至った。
sen.e: This method was widely spread after the nationalization of Kansai Railway Company as it is easy for passengers to identify the grade of the train.
This method became widespread after the nationalization of the Kansai Railway Company, since it was easy for passengers to identify the grade of the train.
This method became widespread after the nationalization of the Kansai Railway Company, since it was easy for passengers to identify the grade of the train.

sen.j: また駅名標によく併設されている「駅周辺名所観光案内」も、1893年（明治26年）に関西鉄道が考案したといわれる。
sen.e: Also the idea of providing 'Area map and information' together with the name of each station originally came from Kansai Railway Company in 1893.
Additionally, the idea of providing an 'area map and information' together with the name of each station originally came from the Kansai Railway Company in 1893.
Additionally, the idea of providing an 'area map and information' together with the name of each station originally came from the Kansai Railway Company in 1893.
